it.uniroma1.di.simulejos.math

Class BoundingBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniroma1.di.simulejos.math.BoundingBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class BoundingBox
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Describes the bounding box of a three-dimensional mesh of points in the space.
    Author:
    Alberto La Rocca
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Vector3 center
      The center of the box.
      Vector3 max
      The upper right back corner of the box.
      Vector3 min
      The lower front left corner of the box.
      Vector3 size
      A Vector3 object containing the size of the box along the X, Y and Z axes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoundingBox(float[] vertices)
      Constructs a BoundingBox by analytizing a three-dimensional mesh of points, or vertices, in the space and computing the smallest possible orthogonal box containing all the points.
      BoundingBox(Vector3 min, Vector3 max)
      Directly constructs a BoundingBox by specifying its min and max fields and subsequently computing size and center instead of analytizing a mesh.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(Vector3 v)
      Returns a boolean value indicating whether the specified point is contained in this bounding box.
      double getMaxSpan()
      Returns the maximum span of the box along the X, Y or Z axis.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • min

        public final Vector3 min
        The lower front left corner of the box. The three values contained in this Vector3 object are the overall lowest X, Y and Z values of all the points in the original mesh.

      • max

        public final Vector3 max
        The upper right back corner of the box. The three values contained in this Vector3 object are the overall highest X, Y and Z values of all the points in the original mesh.

      • size

        public final Vector3 size
        A Vector3 object containing the size of the box along the X, Y and Z axes.

      • center

        public final Vector3 center
        The center of the box. This is equivalent to max.plus(min).div(2).

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoundingBox

        public BoundingBox(Vector3 min,
           Vector3 max)
        Directly constructs a BoundingBox by specifying its min and max fields and subsequently computing size and center instead of analytizing a mesh.
        Parameters:
        min - The lower front left corner of the box. It will be assigned to the min field.
        max - The upper right back corner of the box. It will be assigned to the max field.

      • BoundingBox

        public BoundingBox(float[] vertices)
        Constructs a BoundingBox by analytizing a three-dimensional mesh of points, or vertices, in the space and computing the smallest possible orthogonal box containing all the points.
        Parameters:
        vertices - A flattened array of vertex coordinates: each triple of subsequent floating point elements represents the X, Y and Z (respectively) coordinates of a point in the space.

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Vector3 v)
        Returns a boolean value indicating whether the specified point is contained in this bounding box.
        Parameters:
        v - A point in the three-dimensional space.
        Returns:
        true if the specified point is contained in this bounding box, false otherwise.

      • getMaxSpan

        public double getMaxSpan()
        Returns the maximum span of the box along the X, Y or Z axis. In pseudocode, this method computes Math.max(size.x, size.y, size.z).
        Returns:
        The maximum span of the box along the X, Y or Z axis.
